body_html:
I am having same issues issues am i am not able to install tensorflow on anaconda .Error my mac throws is The directory '/Users/muktamani/Library/Caches/pip/http' or its parent directory is not owned by the current user and the cache has been disabled. Please check the permissions and owner of that directory. If executing pip with sudo, you may want sudo's -H flag.
The directory '/Users/muktamani/Library/Caches/pip' or its parent directory is not owned by the current user and caching wheels has been disabled. check the permissions and owner of that directory. If executing pip with sudo, you may want sudo's -H flag.

But I could sort out with conda install -c conda-forge tensorflow
Thanks @abhi18av

body:
I am having same issues issues am i am not able to install  tensorflow on anaconda .Error my mac throws is  The directory '/Users/muktamani/Library/Caches/pip/http' or its parent directory is not owned by the current user and the cache has been disabled. Please check the permissions and owner of that directory. If executing pip with sudo, you may want sudo's -H flag.
The directory '/Users/muktamani/Library/Caches/pip' or its parent directory is not owned by the current user and caching wheels has been disabled. check the permissions and owner of that directory. If executing pip with sudo, you may want sudo's -H flag.

But I could sort out with conda install -c conda-forge tensorflow
Thanks @abhi18av
